key_title: Key to the species of Gentianella

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Dicotyledons
Key to the genera of Gentianaceae

leads.lead_text: Pedicels mostly 0.8–1 mm diam. when fresh, 0.5 mm or more dry; calyx-lobes mostly longer than 7 mm (but only 4–5 mm long in Baw Baw Plateau endemic C. bawbawensis); corolla-lobes mostly longer than 10 mm, usually prominently dark-veined; plants mostly biennial or perennial, usually developing a stout basal stem (bearing scars of previous years leaves), flowering Jan.-Apr

Pedicels subfiliform, mostly less than 0.8 mm diam. when fresh, 0.3–0.5 (–0.7) mm diam. dry; calyx-lobes rarely exceeding 7 mm; corolla-lobes to 10 mm long, often pure white or with faintly coloured veins; plants short-lived (apparently annual, possibly biennial), not developing a stout basal stem, flowering Sep.-Dec
Calyx-lobes 5–12 mm long; stems usually more than 5-flowered; alpine areas generally
Calyx-lobes 4–5 mm long; stems 3–5-flowered; rare and apparently endemic on Baw Baw Plateau

Calyx-lobes mostly more than 4 times as long as wide; margins (and sometimes surfaces) of bracts and calyx-lobes papillose-scabrous; stems usually 25–55 cm high; anthers mostly c. 2 mm long (rarely longer); plants monocarpic (flowering only once)

Calyx-lobes mostly less than 4 times as long as wide; stems 15–25 (–30) cm high; margins of bracts and calyx-lobes smooth or minutely papillose-scabrous; anthers (2–) 2.3–3 mm long; plants sometimes flowering more than once (remnants of previous years inflorescence sometimes apparent)

Basal leaves narrow-oblanceolate, 3–7 mm wide, acute; pedicels of upper flowers usually 1–2 cm long; calyx-lobes 4–6 (–7) mm long; seeds straw-yellow to dull orange, 0.5–0.7 mm long; lowlands west of Port Phillip Bay

Basal leaves oblanceolate-spathulate, 5–10 mm wide, obtuse; pedicels of upper flowers usually 2–4 cm long; calyx-lobes 5–7 (–9) mm long; seeds pale to greyish-orange; foothill, montane or subalpine areas
